paragraphs.title: Checking for null values in each column
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

all_columns=[ "address_type", "agency",  "agency_name", "bbl", "borough", "bridge_highway_direction", "bridge_highway_name", "bridge_highway_segment", "city", "closed_date", "community_board", "complaint_type", "created_date", "cross_street_1", "cross_street_2", "descriptor", "due_date", "facility_type", "incident_address", "incident_zip", "intersection_street_1", "intersection_street_2", "landmark", "latitude", "location", "longitude", "open_data_channel_type", "park_borough", "park_facility_name", "resolution_action_updated_date", "resolution_description", "road_ramp", "status", "street_name", "taxi_company_borough", "taxi_pick_up_location","unique_key", "vehicle_type", "x_coordinate_state_plane", "y_coordinate_state_plane"]
for m in all_columns:
    print(m,df.select(m).withColumn('isNull_c',F.col(m).isNull()).where('isNull_c = True').count())

paragraphs.text:
%md
Considerando la información que nos da el schema y la tabla de arriba donde podemos ver registro a registro, tenemos algunas inconsistencias en el tipo asignado a las variables que son fechas.

Por otro lado tambien podemos ver que los valores nulos no estan estandarizados entre variables (columnas).

paragraphs.text:
%md
Podemos observar que los valores como N/A, nan y vacios ahora aparecen como null.

msg.data: Podemos observar que los valores como N/A, nan y vacios ahora aparecen como null.

paragraphs.text:
%md
Ahora obtendremos el número de nulos por columna.

msg.data: Ahora obtendremos el número de nulos por columna.

paragraphs.title: Conteo de nulos por columna ({columna}, {registros nulos}, {porcentaje de nulos})
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import functions as F


cols = df2.schema.names
total = float(df2.count())
for c in cols:
    nulos = float(df2.filter(df2[c].isNull()).count())
    print(c , nulos, "{:.4f}".format(nulos/total))

%md
### Limpieza - Corregimos el tipo de las columnas

msg.data: Limpieza - Corregimos el tipo de las columnas

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import functions as F

timeFmt = "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS"
created_date = F.unix_timestamp('created_date', format=timeFmt)
closed_date = F.unix_timestamp('closed_date', format=timeFmt)
resolution_action_updated_date = F.unix_timestamp('resolution_action_updated_date', format=timeFmt)
due_date = F.unix_timestamp('due_date', format=timeFmt)

df2 = df2.withColumn("created_date", created_date)
df2 = df2.withColumn("closed_date", closed_date)
df2 = df2.withColumn("resolution_action_updated_date", resolution_action_updated_date)
df2 = df2.withColumn("due_date", due_date)

df2.printSchema()

root

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import functions as F


cols_str = [item[0] for item in df2.dtypes if item[1].startswith('string')]
for c in cols_str:
    col = F.lower(df2[c]).alias(c)
    df2 = df2.withColumn(c, col)

paragraphs.title: Creating three new variables: most important "Duration_days"
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import functions as F
timeFmt = "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS"
timeDiff = (F.unix_timestamp('closed_date', format=timeFmt)
            - F.unix_timestamp('created_date', format=timeFmt))
df = df.withColumn("Duration", timeDiff)
df=df.withColumn("Duration_hours", df.Duration / 3600.0)
df=df.withColumn("Duration_days", df.Duration_hours /24)

paragraphs.title: Printing out complaints per month and year
Average counts by created_year and created_month
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.sql.functions import countDistinct, avg, stddev

df.select("created_year").count().avg().show())

paragraphs.title: Cross Tabulation
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
estatus = ["Closed - Testing", "Open", "In Progress", "Unspecified", "Cancelled", "Unassigned", "Draft", "Started", "Email Sent", "Pending", "Closed", "Assigned"]
year = ["2010", "2011", "2012", "2013", "2014", "2015", "2016", "2017", "2018", "2019", "2020"]
df = sqlContext.createDataFrame([(estatus[i % 12], year[i % 11]) for i in range(100)], ["estatus", "year"])

paragraphs.title: Cross Tabulation
paragraphs.text:
